data.title: Grand venue
data.text: I attended the Miss Georgia Pageant at the RiverCenter for the Performing Arts in the Bill Heard Theatre.  The seats are covered in a beautiful blue and gold materials. We were on Row V of the Orchestra and had AMAZING seats.  Most seats here are great!

data.title: 42nd Street was outstanding
data.text: Went with a friend and we thoroughly enjoyed the show. The venue is great. Not a bad seat. We had balcony seats and still could see everything. Performers were amazing. Music was great. Loved it!!

data.title: What a wonderful evening with the CSO
data.text: Went to Columbus for the weekend for my husbands birthday and we enjoyed the symphony.  We had never been to Rivercenter, but it is an amazing place.  We went early to attend the "Know the Score" where we heard explanations about the evening's music and enjoyed a question and answer time with the guest pianist.  What a great way to prepare us for the music.  We were given a complementary glass of wine to enjoy during that time as well and the orchestra was wonderful. The facilities are lovely and we will be returning.

data.title: Just Grand
data.text: Every time we go it is so enjoyable! Never have we been disappointed in any of the performances or concerts.  The parking garage is just across the street so its easy access. The staff is always so nice and willing to help. It's just a Grand Venue!

data.title: Nutcracker Columbus Ballet
data.text: Went to see the Columbus Ballet performance of the Nutcracker. Excellent facility and outstanding performance. The only problem I encountered was how people were still be allowed to enter 30 minutes into the performance. For most attractions once they close the doors no one may enter until intermission. People streaming in during a ballet is distracting and rude.

data.title: Beautiful facility!
data.text: Saw a comedy show, staff very nice and helpful. Nice intimate venue, comfortable seating. We found parking a few blocks away, short walk. would definitely attend other events.

data.title: A Gem in the South
data.text: This is a beautiful venue and offers top rate entertainment for the area.  Plays and concerts are presented for all ages and in all genres---and it is now the home of the Miss Georgia Pageant.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Been here a few times for different events. Its a great place to have weddings or gathers.I like the set up and its very nice.

data.title: Nice place to see a show
data.text: I love seeing shows at this theater. It's easy to get in and out. The theater is beautiful. The seating is very comfortable. They have a variety of different shows. I highly recommend this theater.

data.title: An excellent, very professional performing arts venue
data.text:
My wife & I have enjoyed performances at the RiverCenter many times over the past 12 years.   We thought that the excellent staging of "The Great Gatsby" on Saturday 4/18 was particularly remarkable for its one-set creativity & the quality of its small, talented touring company.  That the theater could do this so well for only one night was a fine example of its diverse, high-quality programming.

Detracting somewhat from our experiences, we've found that the rows of seats are so closely spaced that getting in & out past other people can be awkward.  Also, the acoustics, while fairly good, can muffle the voices of performers who don't enunciate well, even with small, personal microphones.  But these are small quibbles, in light of all the pluses.

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: We saw a comedy show here and the venue is beautiful.. Acoustics were awesome.  Easy parking across the street.  Plenty of options for food and drinks nearby before or after a show.   Can't wait to go again.

data.title: Great center
data.text: Loved this center. The location was convenient and easily accommodated a large number of people. The sound was good, and the seating was comfortable.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: I went there for a gospel concert was was very pleased. The facility was spotless and the staff was kind and welcoming. I sat in the balcony but the sound was amazing. I would definitely visit this place again

data.title: opera show
data.text: i didnt like the long walk from parking to the building ..i would suggest maybe some type of cart to carry visitors that need it from vehicles

data.title: Great Arts Venue!!!
data.text:
This is a wonderful venue for any arts that it presents! The main auditorium hosts many Broadway shows that come to Columbus as well as concerts from many big artist. There doesn't seem to be a bad seat in the house!
The smaller auditorium houses a grand, awe inspiring organ that is world famous. If you are fortunate enough to catch an organ concert, attend, by all means!

data.title: Top Notch!
data.text: When it comes to theaters, the RiverCenter is the best. There are many acts, shows and performers who visit the RiverCenter. We have seen many shows here and are always impressed. I would highly recommend seeing a performance at the RiverCenter.

data.title: Top Notch Venue
data.text: The RiverCenter is a great place for a concert or show.  Bigger events end up in the Civic Center, but the RC is a more plush, intimate setting.  The acoustics are good and parking and access is excellent.

data.title: Great Acoustics
data.text: The sight lines in the theatre are about perfect from any seats. The leg room is wonderful and the seats comfortable. Our only negative has been some of the volunteers who carry on conversations in the back where we normally sit.

data.title: Beautiful theater
data.text: Another wonderful theater in Columbus, GA.  There are no bad seats at this theater.  Great shows a lot cheaper then Atlanta.

data.title: Excellent events
data.text: There is almost always something going on at the River Center, and a lot of it is free. Students play for audiences with no charge.
